jparsec.ephem

Class PhysicalParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.PhysicalParameters

  • public class PhysicalParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to obtain the orientation and physical ephemeris of a planet, based on IAU 2000/2006/2009 recomendations. The different implementations are used for the different values of the ephem method to apply in the ephemeris object. The default method (for values different from IAU 2006 and IAU 2009) is the IAU 2000 recommendations for the orientations of the planetary axes.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Ephem

    • Method Detail

      • physicalParameters

        public static EphemElement physicalParameters(double JD,
                              EphemElement ephem_sun,
                              EphemElement ephem_obj,
                              ObserverElement obs,
                              EphemerisElement eph)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Obtain physical parameters of the planet: elongation, phase, phase angle, angular radius, visual magnitude (AA supplement), and axis orientation. This method is applicable for the Sun, the Moon, any planet, Pluto, and the asteroids Ida, Vesta, Gaspra, and Eros. Previous calculation of basic ephemeris is required.

        The axis orientation for the Moon is computed using Eckhardt's theory, instead of the IAU rotation model.

        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in dynamical time.
        ephem_sun - Ephem object with ephemeris of sun (should be apparent, equinox of date).
        ephem_obj - Ephem object to take and store data (should be apparent, equinox of date).
        obs - The Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object defining the ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        EphemElement with the completed data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the object data cannot be found.

      • getPlanetaryAxisDirection

        public static LocationElement getPlanetaryAxisDirection(double JD,
                                        EphemerisElement eph)
                                                 throws JPARSECException
        Returns the direction of the north pole of rotation of a planet for a given date.
        Parameters:
        JD - The Julian day.
        eph - Ephemeris properties with target body, ephemeris reduction method, and output equinox.
        Returns:
        The direction of the north pole of rotation, or null if it is not available.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • calcAxis

        public static EphemElement calcAxis(double JD,
                    EphemElement ephem_sun,
                    EphemElement ephem_obj,
                    double lon0,
                    double rot_per_day,
                    EphemerisElement eph,
                    Target.TARGET motherBody)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Calculate orientation of a planet providing the position and the direction of the north pole of rotation. Previous calculation of basic ephemeris is required, as well as knowledge of axis orientation. The IAU 2000/2006/2009 models are used, see REPORT OF THE IAU/IAG WORKING GROUP ON CARTOGRAPHIC COORDINATES AND ROTATIONAL ELEMENTS: 2009, B. A. Archinal et al, in Celestial Mechanics and Dynamical Astronomy, 2011.

        Note 1: The program use the dynamical north pole of rotation. In giant planets, an offset between dynamical and magnetic north pole will exist. So, for these planets, longitude of central meridian in System III and subsolar longitude values should be taken with caution.

        Note 2: No correction is performed for object radius. In giant planets like Jupiter (or Saturn), with radius of 70 000 km = 0.25 light-seconds, a discrepancy up to +0.003 degrees can be expected with other sources. Since this is a difference in light time that affects the central meridian longitude on the disk in certain instant, this correction depends on the position in the disk surface.

        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in TDB.
        ephem_sun - EphemElement with all data for the sun.
        ephem_obj - EphemElement with all data completed except those fields related to the disk orientation.
        lon0 - Initial longitude of planet at JD = 2451545.0.
        rot_per_day - Rotation speed in degrees/day.
        eph - Ephemeris object defining the ephemeris properties.
        motherBody - The mother body for the calculations. Can be set to null for the Earth.
        Returns:
        Ephem object with all the fields.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • setPhysicalParameters

        public static void setPhysicalParameters(EphemElement ephem_output,
                         EphemElement ephem_input,
                         TimeElement time,
                         ObserverElement obs,
                         EphemerisElement eph)
        Sets the physical parameters of one Ephem object into another. Fields are angular radius, defect of illumination, elongation, phase, phase angle, constellation, axis PA, pole PA, bright limb angle, subsolar and sub-Earth positions, magnitude, and surface brightness. In case ephemerides are calculated respect a body different from Earth, the correct constellation name is calculated by obtaining internally the equivalent Earth-based position.
        Parameters:
        ephem_output - The output object, their fields will be modified.
        ephem_input - The input object, their fields will be taken to modify the output object.
        time - Time object.
        obs - Observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object.

      • getBodyMeanRotationRate

        public static double getBodyMeanRotationRate(EphemerisElement eph)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the mean rotation rate of a given body using the corresponding IAU model.
        Parameters:
        eph - Ephemeris object containing target body and ephemeris method.
        Returns:
        The rotation rate in radians/second.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getBodySiderealTimeAt0Lon

        public static double getBodySiderealTimeAt0Lon(double JD_TDB,
                               EphemerisElement eph)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the sidereal time at 0º of longitude of a given body using the corresponding IAU model.
        Parameters:
        JD_TDB - Julian day in TDB.
        eph - Ephemeris object containing target body and ephemeris method.
        Returns:
        Apparent sidereal time in radians for an observer at longitude 0.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getBodyNorthPole

        public static LocationElement getBodyNorthPole(double JD_TDB,
                               EphemerisElement eph)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the orientation of the north pole of rotation of a given body using the corresponding IAU model. This method gives the same value as getPlanetaryAxisDirection(double, EphemerisElement).
        Parameters:
        JD_TDB - Julian day in TDB.
        eph - Ephemeris object containing target body, ephemeris method, and output equinox.
        Returns:
        North pole direction.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
